title: Why does pigeon technology produce Mg with low purity? - Quora

response.answer_text: Look up Pidgeon Process ( the D is important because it was named after Dr. Lloyd Pidgeon). To simplify greatly, the two most commonly used chemicals ( CO2 ans SiO2) that are used in smelting to gather impurities in metals and cause them to rise to the top as slag, react unfavorably with Magnesium and either boil off without collecting impurities or react with the Mg to cause impurities. Pidgeon process - Wikipedia.
